projects.title: FEMA Floodplain Remapping Initiative
projects.description: Led a multi-county project to update and modernize FEMA Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMs). The project involved detailed 1D and 2D hydraulic modeling using HEC-RAS to accurately delineate floodplains, providing critical data for risk assessment and urban planning.

projects.title: Urban Drainage System Redesign
projects.description: Designed a comprehensive retrofit of an aging urban stormwater system for a major metropolitan area. The solution incorporated green infrastructure elements like permeable pavements and bioswales, modeled in SWMM to optimize performance and reduce combined sewer overflow events.

projects.title: Watershed Delineation for Eco-Reserve
projects.description: Utilized high-resolution LiDAR data and ArcGIS Pro to perform a detailed watershed delineation for a sensitive ecological reserve. The analysis identified critical sub-basins and flow paths, informing conservation strategies and land management policies.

projects.title: Contaminant Plume Modeling
projects.description: Developed a 3D groundwater model using MODFLOW to simulate the transport of a contaminant plume from an industrial site. The model was calibrated with field data and used to evaluate the effectiveness of various remediation scenarios, leading to a more efficient and cost-effective cleanup strategy.

projects.title: Dam Break Analysis & Emergency Action Plan
projects.description: Conducted a dam break analysis for a high-hazard potential dam, generating detailed inundation maps for various failure scenarios. The results formed the basis of a comprehensive Emergency Action Plan (EAP) that was approved by state regulators.

projects.title: Green Infrastructure Suitability Analysis
projects.description: Performed a GIS-based multi-criteria suitability analysis to identify optimal locations for green infrastructure implementation within a city. The study considered soil types, slope, land use, and proximity to existing drainage systems to maximize stormwater capture potential.

testimonials.quote: J. Doe's hydraulic models are meticulous. The clarity and accuracy of the HEC-RAS analysis for our floodplain remapping project were instrumental in gaining regulatory approval ahead of schedule.
testimonials.author: Jane Smith
testimonials.title: Lead Planner, Tri-County Planning Commission

testimonials.quote: The GIS suitability analysis provided was a game-changer. It allowed us to strategically deploy green infrastructure with confidence, maximizing our ROI and environmental impact.
testimonials.author: Robert Johnson
testimonials.title: Director of Public Works, City of Metropolis

blogPosts.title: Comparing 1D vs. 2D Modeling in HEC-RAS for Urban Floodplains
blogPosts.excerpt: A deep dive into the practical considerations and outcomes when choosing between 1D and 2D hydraulic modeling approaches for complex urban environments.
blogPosts.metaDescription: Explore a detailed comparison of 1D and 2D HEC-RAS modeling for urban floodplains, including accuracy, computational cost, and best-use cases for civil engineers.

blogPosts.title: The Impact of Climate Data on Modern Hydrological Analysis
blogPosts.excerpt: How updated climate projections are reshaping stormwater design standards and the methodologies used to ensure long-term infrastructure resilience.
blogPosts.metaDescription: Learn how modern climate projection data is fundamentally changing hydrological analysis and stormwater management design standards for increased resilience.

blogPosts.title: Common Pitfalls in SWMM Calibration & How to Avoid Them
blogPosts.excerpt: An exploration of the most common challenges faced during the calibration of urban drainage models and strategies to improve model accuracy and reliability.
blogPosts.metaDescription: A technical guide for hydrologists on avoiding common pitfalls in EPA SWMM calibration to achieve more accurate and reliable urban drainage models.
